subtype:
/-- If a family is convex independent, so is any subfamily indexed by a subtype of the index type.

protected theorem convex_independent.subtype {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ p) (s : set Î¹) :

/-- If an indexed family of points is convex independent, so is the corresponding set of points. -/
protected theorem convex_independent.range {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ p) :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (fun x => x : Set.range p â†’ E) :=

  convert hc.comp_embedding fe
  ext
  rw [embedding.coe_fn_mk, comp_app, hf]

mono:
/-- A subset of a convex independent set of points is convex independent as well. -/
protected theorem convex_independent.mono {s t : set E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ (fun x => x : t â†’ E)) (hs : s âŠ† t) :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (fun x => x : s â†’ E) :=
  hc.comp_embedding (s.embedding_of_subset t hs)

/-- If a family is convex independent, a point in the family is in the convex hull of some of the
points given by a subset of the index type if and only if the point's index is in this subset. -/
@[simp]
protected theorem convex_independent.mem_convex_hull_iff {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ p) (s : set Î¹) (i : Î¹) :
    p i âˆˆ convex_hull ğ•œ (Â«expr '' Â» p s) â†” i âˆˆ s :=
  âŸ¨hc _ _, fun hi => subset_convex_hull ğ•œ _ (Set.mem_image_of_mem p hi)âŸ©
#align convex_independent.mem_convex_hull_iff convex_independent.mem_convex_hull_iff
injective:
/-- A convex independent family is injective. -/
protected theorem convex_independent.injective {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ p) : function.injective p :=
  by
  refine' fun i j hij => hc {j} i _
  rw [hij, Set.image_singleton, convex_hull_singleton]
  exact Set.mem_singleton _
#align convex_independent.injective convex_independent.injective
convex_independent_set_iff_not_mem_conve:
/-- If a set is convex independent, a point in the set is not in the convex hull of the other
points. See `convex_independent_iff_not_mem_convex_hull_diff` for the indexed family version.  -/
theorem convex_independent_set_iff_not_mem_convex_hull_diff {s : set E} :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (fun x => x : s â†’ E) â†” âˆ€ x âˆˆ s, x âˆ‰ convex_hull ğ•œ (s \ {x}) :=

  Â· rintro hs t ht x âŸ¨hxs, hxtâŸ©
    by_contra h
    exact hs _ hxs (convex_hull_mono (Set.subset_diff_singleton ht h) hxt)

theorem convex_independent_set_iff_inter_convex_hull_subset {s : set E} :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (fun x => x : s â†’ E) â†” âˆ€ t, t âŠ† s â†’ s âˆ© convex_hull ğ•œ t âŠ† t :=

/-- The range of an injective indexed family of points is convex independent iff that family is. -/
theorem function.injective.convex_independent_iff_set {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hi : function.injective p) :

    convex_independent.rangeâŸ©

convex_independent_iff_not_mem_convex_hu:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr '' Â» -/
/-- If a family is convex independent, a point in the family is not in the convex hull of the other
points. See `convex_independent_set_iff_not_mem_convex_hull_diff` for the `set` version.  -/
theorem convex_independent_iff_not_mem_convex_hull_diff {p : Î¹ â†’ E} :

convex_independent_iff_finset:
/-- To check convex independence, one only has to check finsets thanks to CarathÃ©odory's theorem. -/
theorem convex_independent_iff_finset {p : Î¹ â†’ E} :
    convex_independent ğ•œ p â†” âˆ€ (s : Finset Î¹) (x : Î¹), p x âˆˆ convex_hull ğ•œ (s.image p : set E) â†’ x âˆˆ s :=
  by
  refine' âŸ¨fun hc s x hx => hc s x _, fun h s x hx => _âŸ©
  Â· rwa [Finset.coe_image] at hx
  have hp : injective p := by
    rintro a b hab
    rw [â† mem_singleton]
    refine' h {b} a _
    rw [hab, image_singleton, coe_singleton, convex_hull_singleton]
    exact Set.mem_singleton _
  rw [convex_hull_eq_union_convex_hull_finite_subsets] at hx
  simp_rw [Set.mem_unionáµ¢] at hx
  obtain âŸ¨t, ht, hxâŸ© := hx
  rw [â† hp.mem_set_image]
  refine' ht _
  suffices x âˆˆ t.preimage p (hp.inj_on _) by rwa [mem_preimage, â† mem_coe] at this
  refine' h _ x _
  rwa [t.image_preimage p (hp.inj_on _), filter_true_of_mem]
  Â· exact fun y hy => s.image_subset_range p (ht <| mem_coe.2 hy)
#align convex_independent_iff_finset convex_independent_iff_finset
convex_independent_extreme_points:
theorem convex.convex_independent_extreme_points (hs : convex ğ•œ s) :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (fun p => p : s.extreme_points ğ•œ â†’ E) :=
  convex_independent_set_iff_not_mem_convex_hull_diff.2 fun x hx h =>
    (extreme_points_convex_hull_subset

      (Set.mem_singleton _)
#align convex.convex_independent_extreme_points convex.convex_independent_extreme_points

/-- A family with at most one point is convex independent. -/
theorem subsingleton.convex_independent [subsingleton Î¹] (p : Î¹ â†’ E) : convex_independent ğ•œ p := fun s x hx =>
  by
  have : (convex_hull ğ•œ (Â«expr '' Â» p s)).nonempty := âŸ¨p x, hxâŸ©
  rw [convex_hull_nonempty_iff, Set.nonempty_image_iff] at this
  rwa [Subsingleton.mem_iff_nonempty]
#align subsingleton.convex_independent subsingleton.convex_independent
comp_embedding:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr â†ª Â» -/
/-- If a family is convex independent, so is any subfamily given by composition of an embedding into
index type with the original family. -/
theorem convex_independent.comp_embedding {Î¹' : Type _} (f : Â«expr â†ª Â» Î¹' Î¹) {p : Î¹ â†’ E} (hc : convex_independent ğ•œ p) :
    convex_independent ğ•œ (p âˆ˜ f) := by

  rw [â† f.injective.mem_set_image]
  exact hc _ _ (by rwa [Set.image_image])
#align convex_independent.comp_embedding convex_independent.comp_embedding
